Wisconsin: s tourism secretary, Sara Meaney, claims that the state has 15,000 lakes, which is more than Minnesota.
Minnesota is known as the: Land of 10,000 Lakes" based on its definition of a lake as a body of water greater than 10 acres.
According to the National Hydrography Da: Minnesota has more lake/pond features than Wisconsin, with 124,662 compared to Wisconsin's 82,099.
